intro: Linum flos-carmini, commonly known as crimson flax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Linaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are slightly hairy. Its flowers are borne in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. The seeds of Linum flos-carmini are small and oval, often used in traditional herbal remedies.
